intro: Psephellus yildizii, commonly known as the Yildiz's psephellus, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Turkey. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leaf structures. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
